simulated_ratings.title: Passion of the Christ, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Powerful but too graphic and solemn for my tastes outside war/history epics.

simulated_ratings.title: Heavy Metal (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Anthology of dark fantasy and erotic sci‑fi isn’t my lane, despite some pulp charm.

simulated_ratings.title: Left Behind: The Movie (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: End-times premise intrigues me, but the execution feels thin compared to sturdier war/thriller fare.

simulated_ratings.title: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some goofy laughs, but the nonstop mugging gets old for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Joe Dirt (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Good-natured underdog road trip, but the humor is hit-or-miss.

simulated_ratings.title: Dumb & Dumber (Dumb and Dumber) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, silly gags land more often than not

simulated_ratings.title: Doctor Dolittle (1967)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-fashioned musical whimsy with animals—pleasant more than exciting.

simulated_ratings.title: Nutty Professor, The (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever classic comedy premise with a fun Jekyll/Hyde spin.

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Parody overload

simulated_ratings.title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes (1970)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Interesting continuation with eerie ideas, but not as gripping as the setup.

simulated_ratings.title: Searchers, The (1956)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping, morally complex western quest that hits my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings, The (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Animated high fantasy doesn’t hook me the way grounded adventure does.

simulated_ratings.title: Ernest Goes to Jail (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Harmless slapstick, but the shtick wears thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Caddyshack (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loose, quotable chaos with enough big laughs to carry it.

simulated_ratings.title: Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: More of the same, louder and sillier, which works less for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Planet of the Apes (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, adventurous sci‑fi with a strong hook and atmosphere I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Flashy space opera without the grit or weight I gravitate toward.

simulated_ratings.title: Alamo, The (1960)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stirring, old-school tale of sacrifice and siege right in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Arthur (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Charming in spots, though the romance/drama beats don’t resonate strongly for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Soylent Green (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, compelling sci‑fi thriller with themes I enjoy chewing on.

simulated_ratings.title: Benji (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet family adventure

simulated_ratings.title: Omega Man, The (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, survivalist sci‑fi that scratches the post-apocalyptic itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Quiet Man, The (1952)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, picturesque romance with enough spark and humor to win me over.

simulated_ratings.title: Ben-Hur (1959)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand, muscular epic storytelling that I love.

simulated_ratings.title: Omega Code, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Prophecy-thriller angle is interesting, but it lacks the punch I look for.

simulated_ratings.title: Batman: The Killing Joke (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dark crime themes intrigue me, but the animated delivery keeps me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Conan the Barbarian (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sinewy sword-and-sorcery revenge ride—fun, if less my wheelhouse than war/Western grit.

simulated_ratings.title: Phantasm (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Weird horror vibes and gore aren’t my thing, despite the sci‑fi touches.

simulated_ratings.title: Apostle, The (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Strong performance-driven faith drama, but that solemn lane isn’t where I live.

simulated_ratings.title: Hardcore Henry (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wall-to-wall, flashy mayhem leaves me cold despite the premise.

simulated_ratings.title: The Murders in the Rue Morgue (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mystery angle interests me, but the horror TV-movie vibe isn’t my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: The Light in the Forest (1958)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-school frontier coming-of-age hits my Western/adventure sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Pride and Prejudice (1995)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy international spy shenanigans with nimble action I can enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Cruise, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky city character study that’s pleasant but far from my usual interests.

simulated_ratings.title: Marvel One-Shot: Item 47 (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, disposable superhero-adjacent fluff without the grit I like.

simulated_ratings.title: World Is Not Enough, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Modern Bond thrills and espionage satisfy, if not top-tier for me.

simulated_ratings.title: New World (Shin-sae-gye) (2013)

simulated_ratings.title: Climax (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Druggy, nightmarish descent is exactly the kind of horror I avoid.

simulated_ratings.title: Billy Jack (1971)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tough, principled loner fighting back scratches my 70s action itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Taken (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim, intimate abuse/revenge drama isn’t a lane I enjoy spending time in.

simulated_ratings.title: George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya! (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp, cynical stand-up with some laughs, but the tone isn’t fully my beat.

simulated_ratings.title: 50 Years of Star Trek (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Nostalgic sci-fi retrospectives are enjoyable enough, if not essential for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Chelsea Handler: Evolution (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Personal therapy-and-cannabis riffing isn’t my brand of comedy.

simulated_ratings.title: Deception (1946)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy classic-era melodrama with music and jealousy that I can get into.

simulated_ratings.title: Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, punchy Bond entry that gets the job done for my spy-thriller fix.

simulated_ratings.title: Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Criminals-on-their-heels setup works, though the 90s stylings temper my enthusiasm.

simulated_ratings.title: Trigger Effect, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blackout survival tension and morality play are right up my thriller alley.
Patriotic, talky period piece appeals to my history streak despite the stagey musical tone.

simulated_ratings.title: Godzilla vs. SpaceGodzilla (Gojira VS Supesugojira) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Big, goofy kaiju clash I can enjoy as light sci-fi adventure.

simulated_ratings.title: Dogra Magra (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Asylum-set psychological horror loses me despite the mystery trappings.

simulated_ratings.title: Design of Death (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Village whodunit framework is engaging enough, even if the modern sheen isn’t my favorite.

simulated_ratings.title: Mummy, The (1932)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, restrained classic horror with enough atmosphere for me to appreciate.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Hilarious (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Candid, cynical bits give me some laughs, even if stand-up isn’t my main lane.

simulated_ratings.title: Brüno (Bruno) (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Crude prank shock-humor wears thin fast for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Buffalo '66 (a.k.a. Buffalo 66) (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Offbeat, rough-edged character piece I can appreciate more than love.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Shameless (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw domestic-life riffs land decently, though the format limits my enthusiasm.

simulated_ratings.title: Dictator, The (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, abrasive satire with a few chuckles but not my style.

simulated_ratings.title: Hamlet (1964)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic tragedy earns respect, though the stagey TV presentation keeps me at a remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Hannah Montana: The Movie (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tween pop-musical sheen just isn’t for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Saw VI (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: What About Bob? (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Odd-couple neediness vs. composure delivers steady, good-natured laughs.

simulated_ratings.title: Blues Brothers 2000 (1998)

simulated_ratings.title: War, The (1994)

simulated_ratings.title: Saw V (2008)

simulated_ratings.title: Sasq-Watch! (2017)

simulated_ratings.title: Grateful Dead (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: Saw VII 3D - The Final Chapter (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Same gruesome grind, which I actively avoid.

simulated_ratings.title: Unsinkable Molly Brown, The (1964)

simulated_ratings.title: NeverEnding Story III, The (1994)

simulated_ratings.title: Pink Panther 2, The (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: Plan 9 from Outer Space (1959)

simulated_ratings.title: Jigsaw (2017)

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Chewed Up (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blunt, profane observations get some laughs without winning me over.

simulated_ratings.title: Godfather: Part II, The (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping, weighty crime saga I can respect and sink into.

simulated_ratings.title: The Brothers Grimsby (2016)

simulated_ratings.title: Let Him Have It (1991)

simulated_ratings.title: Empire of Light (2022)

simulated_ratings.title: Tokyo Project (2017)

simulated_ratings.title: Saw IV (2007)

simulated_ratings.title: Haunting, The (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, restrained haunted-house chills I can appreciate without loving.

simulated_ratings.title: Alien³ (a.k.a. Alien 3) (1992)

simulated_ratings.title: Final Flight of the Osiris (2003)
